snippet: Some 650 workers who fled the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear reactor plant without permission during the 2011 tsunami may have thought they had been ordered to evacuate, Japanese news media report.
abstract: New details reported by Japanese news media say about 650 workers who fled the Fukushima Daiichi power plant without permission after March 2011 nuclear accident may have left because they thought they were ordered to evacuate.
lead_paragraph: Some 650 workers who fled the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear reactor plant without permission during the 2011 tsunami may have thought they had been ordered to evacuate, Japanese news media report.

headline.main: Fukushima Workers Who Fled May Have Received Garbled Orders, Reports Say
headline.print_headline: Japan: Nuclear Workers May Have Fled Plant Because of a Miscommunication
